Title: Stock Associate (Birch Lane)
RoleDescription:
OVERVIEW & JOB DESCRIPTION 
Stock Associates contribute to the success of Birch Lane by inspiring customers to embrace our Classic Style for Joyful Living. As a member of the Birch Lane team, you will embrace a culture that promotes a relentless customer focus and help guests confidently create a home where lifes magical moments  unfold.  
 The base pay for this position is $17.50 per hour.
WHAT YOULL DO 

Provide an authentic, friendly customer experience that exemplifies our Wayfair commitment to relentless customer focus. 
Manage, maintain, and monitor stock levels, receive and process merchandise, and ensure items are properly stored, and easily located for replenishment on the sales floor. 
Support visual merchandising tasks such as maintaining the stores visual standards, floorset, window changes, signage placement, lighting installations, basic electrical wiring, wallpapering, etc., as needed. 
Safely unloading and organizing incoming and outgoing freight as needed. 
Maintaining backroom standards including ticketing as needed. 
Assist with Visual adjacencies and presentations as needed. 
Ensure the store meets visual, replenishment, cleanliness, safety, and back-of-house standards.
Assist customers on the sales floor as needed. 

WHAT YOULL NEED 

1+ years of retail experience; preferably in the home or furnishing space. Interior design, furniture, or  home goods experience preferred. 
An ability to read, interpret, and execute a floorset; Experience in visual merchandising (lighting  installs, wallpapering, furniture assembly, preferred. 
Basic electrical wiring experience preferred. 
Passion for great customer service, operational excellence, and efficiency to meet company goals.
Track record of thriving in a fast-paced and changing environment. 
Strong organization, self-motivation, communication, and relationship management skills.
An ability to handle customer escalations and demonstrate professional maturity. 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk, and  hear. The employee frequently is required to handle or feel and reach with hands and arms. The  employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel,  crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently, or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50  lbs. 
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. 
Ability to ascend/descend a ladder (minimum 10ft) 
Ability to use a variety of hand-held tools,(such as, but not limited to, wire cutter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, hammer, leveler, drill). 
Ability to use basic electrical wiring, associated with lighting installation.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Global Financing
RoleDescription:
Senior Business Analyst, Global FinancingBoston, MA| Office-Based (MonThurs, Fri-WFH)Full-Time
Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership Reimbursement, Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days Starting Holiday + Bank Holidays (with tenure increases), Pension, Cycle to Work scheme, and more
Salary: The salary range for this position is $104,000 - $118,000 per year, however the base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience
The Team & The Role
The Fintech & Loyalty (F&L) organization builds and manages the foundational systems, financial products, and fraud detection and prevention services that provide customers with a secure, seamless, and rewarding payment experience. 
F&L partners with 30+ organizations worldwide to provide a robust selection of gifting, paying, and financing options, to securely process $12B+ in annual transaction volume, and to detect, prevent, and mitigate fraud.
This role is responsible for supporting the profitable growth and optimization of Wayfairs global suite of consumer financing offerings. This includes analyzing program performance, identifying opportunities for improvement, and supporting the execution of strategic initiatives.
What You'll Do


Program Performance Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of consumer financing program performance, including key metrics, customer behavior, and profitability drivers. Identify trends, anomalies, and areas for optimization

Data Reporting & Visualization: Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualizations to track program health, identify key insights, and communicate findings to stakeholders

Opportunity Identification: Proactively identify opportunities to improve program economics, customer experience, and operational efficiency through data analysis and market research

Cross-functional Support: Collaborate closely with Product, Engineering, Analytics, Marketing, Operations, Legal, and Finance teams to provide data-driven insights and support the execution of strategic initiatives

Competitive Benchmarking: Research and analyze competitive financing offerings and industry trends to inform program strategy and identify best practices

Process Improvement: Support the continuous improvement of operating models and operational efficiency within the financing program

Ad-Hoc Analysis: Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support specific business questions and initiatives as needed

Partner Relationships:  Manage day-to-day operations with 6+ financing partners globally, in addition to developing relationships with prospective partners

Documentation: Maintain clear and concise documentation of analyses, methodologies, and key findings

Stakeholder Communication: Effectively communicate complex data insights and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences

What Youll Bring

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field

3+ years of professional experience

Experience in financial services and/or consumer financing (buy-now-pay-later, lending, credit, etc) is a plus

Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI

Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration

High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

Title: Head of Consumer Insights
RoleDescription:
External Job Title: Head of Consumer Insights
Location: Boston HQ (US)
Level: L3, Manager
The base pay for this position is $121,000 - $132,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Wayfair is seeking a seasoned leader in consumer research and analytics to shape and scale our global insights practice. This highly visible role sits at the intersection of brand strategy and customer understanding, responsible for delivering qualitative and quantitative insights that fuel decision-making that drive business impact across all of Wayfairs brands and geographies.
Reporting to the Global Head of Brand & Insights, youll set the vision and roadmap for consumer research at Wayfair, leading foundational work on brand tracking, segmentation, concept testing, and category deep dives, while embedding the voice of the customer across the organization. This role partners closely with Marketing, Product, Service, and our cross-functional insights teams (e.g., UX Research, Customer Happiness) to influence decisions at the highest level.
What Youll Do:

Lead and scale Wayfairs consumer insights practice, aligning research priorities to brand, product, and commercial strategies.
Develop and operationalize an agile, end-to-end research roadmap, balancing foundational studies with fast-turn business needs.
Build clear intake and prioritization processes, drive research rigor, and identify opportunities to automate and streamline execution.
Synthesize complex data into compelling narratives that inform decisions and inspire action across all levels of the organization.
Partner with senior leaders across Brand, Creative, Marketing Channels, Product, and Service to drive clarity and action through insights.
Manage and grow a high-performing team of analysts and researchers, fostering a culture of curiosity, collaboration, and impact.
Oversee research vendors and budgets, ensuring quality, efficiency, and smart investment.

Who Youll Need:

6+ years of experience in consumer insights, market research, or behavioral analytics, with a proven track record of influencing strategic decisions at scale.
2+ years of people leadership, including hiring, mentoring, and developing high-performing research teams.
Expertise in both qualitative and quantitative methods, including segmentation, brand tracking, surveys, concept testing, journey mapping, and NPS/satisfaction, plus fluency in social listening, ethnographies, and focus groups.
Strong analytical fluency and experience working with survey tools (e.g., Qualtrics, SurveyMonkey) and data visualization platforms (e.g., Looker, Looker Studio). Excel proficiency (e.g., pivot tables, vlookup) required; familiarity with SQL or GBQ a plus.
Ability to synthesize behavioral, attitudinal, and market data into compelling narratives with clear, actionable recommendations that influence stakeholders and drive business impact.
Creative and resourceful, with a scrappy, solutions-oriented mindset and a deep appreciation for research rigor and methodological accuracy.
Comfort operating at both strategic and tactical levels, able to set vision while rolling up your sleeves to guide execution and fill gaps as needed.
Exceptional stakeholder management skills and the ability to collaborate cross-functionally, align competing priorities, and drive clarity from ambiguity.
Strong business acumen, with an intuitive grasp of how insights connect to brand, product, and commercial outcomes.
Experience navigating matrixed organizations, building relationships across teams, and embedding customer understanding into decision-making at scale.

Bonus if you have:

Experience leading insights functions within complex consumer businesses (e.g., retail, digital platforms, services, DTC).
Background in digital-forward or high-growth organizations.
Experience integrating research with data science, CRM, or experimentation programs.

Title: Category Management Intern
RoleDescription:
Title: Category Manager (Internship)Location: London Office-Based EC1V 7LQ (MonThurs in office, Fri remote)Duration: 6 monthsSalary: 25,400 (pro rata)
 What is Category Management at Wayfair?
Category Management is where business strategy meets customer experience. Each team owns a specific product category  from lighting and dcor to kitchenware and bedding  and acts as the business owner for that area. We work closely with suppliers, analyse performance, expand our product selection, and shape how customers discover and interact with our products online.
As an Intern, youll dive right into this fast-paced, high-impact world  working with real data, solving real problems, and delivering results that matter.
 What Youll Do
Your exact role will depend on your skills, interests, and team placement, but heres a snapshot of the kind of impact you could have:


Build Relationships: Partner with suppliers and cross-functional teams to keep your category competitive and growing.


Spot Opportunities: Research new vendors and track product trends to expand our range and boost sales.


Own Projects: Lead initiatives from pricing strategies to promotional campaigns.


Analyse & Optimise: Use data and web analytics tools to monitor category performance and identify improvements.


Strategise & Scale: Support the rollout of growth plans in partnership with merchandising, marketing, and operations.


 What Youll Need to Succeed


Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


Strong communication and collaboration skills  you thrive in team settings.


A proactive, can-do mindset  quick to learn, eager to take initiative.


An eye for detail and confidence working independently.


Interest in eCommerce, retail, or home & lifestyle products.


An interest in strategy and analytics, with a commercially minded approach to problem-solving.


Comfortable with Excel and a curiosity for working with data.


 Why Wayfair? Why Now?


Join a global eCommerce leader at the heart of one of its most strategic functions.


Gain real ownership from day one  your ideas will be heard, tested, and celebrated.


Collaborate with top talent and get exposure to multiple business areas, from supply chain to marketing.


Benefit from hands-on mentorship designed to accelerate your learning.


Experience our vibrant, collaborative London office culture.

Title: B2B Sales Specialist- Wayfair Specialty Brands (Joss & Main/AllModern - New England Region
RoleDescription:
The entry pay for this position is $27.50 /hr with uncapped quarterly bonus pay potential. Total compensation may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

B2B Sales Specialist can be based out of stores in Burlington, Lynnfield, or Dedham.

Overview:At Wayfair, were transforming the way businesses shop for their spaces and as an in-store B2B Sales Specialist, youll be on the front lines of that mission. This isnt your typical sales role. Youll act as a trusted partner to local businesses, helping them discover the power of Wayfair Professional and our in-store design expertise. Whether its a boutique hotel redesign, a new office buildout, or ongoing projects for local contractors, such as Interior Designers, youll be their go-to guide for all things Wayfair.
This role blends sales development, community building, and hands-on customer support. Youll grow our professional customer base by connecting with new prospects, activating and growing business from existing accounts, and working closely with in-store teams to bring large-scale projects to life. At Wayfair, we believe in hustle and heart, and in this role youll find both.
Ready to drive impact, grow your pipeline, and help businesses bring their visions to life? Lets make it happen.
What Does a B2B Sales Specialist Do?

 Grow the B2B Business: Build relationships with local Wayfair Professional customers, both new and existing, by prospecting, cold calling, and community engagement. Your goal? Drive awareness, increase in-store program adoption, and help businesses unlock the full potential of the Wayfair Professional Program.
 Engage Local Wayfair Professional Customers: Proactively reach out to existing and potential B2B customers in the local market to promote the value of our in-store experience, encourage visits, and connect them with our Design Specialists. Reengage inactive accounts and uncover new opportunities through tailored outreach and relationship-building strategies.
 Prospect Net-New Customers: Use online research, walk-ins, and cold outreach to connect with business owners across industries. Youll validate enrollment status, pitch program benefits, and help them get started with Wayfair Professional.
 Build Local Partnerships: Develop relationships with area business associations, real estate developers, and design industry organizations. Share insights and collaborate with the home office to scale successful partnership models across markets.
 Coordinate Events: Partner with store leadership and marketing to host monthly in-store B2B events and identify opportunities for community engagement that showcase Wayfairs offerings and expertise.
 Support B2B Projects In-Store: Act as the go-to B2B expert for store teams and customers alike. Youll answer program questions, connect customers to the right design and delivery services, and support complex or large-scale orders.
 Enable the Team: Educate associates on B2B tools, benefits, and workflows. Collaborate closely with our instore and virtual Sales teams to ensure a seamless handoff for customers visiting our store from remote channels.

 
Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Sales Drive: 2-3 years of general sales experience with a proven track record of hitting or exceeding goals, with a preference in B2B development or trade environments.
 Retail Know-How: 12 years of retail experience working with customers, ideally in high-touch or specialty sales settings.
 Great Communication: Youre comfortable building rapport over the phone, in person, or via email. You know how to listen, engage, and follow up like a pro.
 Organizational Excellence: You can juggle multiple priorities without dropping the ballwhether it's planning outreach, logging customer notes in Salesforce, or coordinating an event.
 Strategic Thinking: Youre proactive in identifying opportunities, digging into data, and thinking three steps ahead to unlock growth.
 Tech Comfort: Youre familiar with CRMs (Salesforce), POS systems, and productivity tools like Google Suite.
 Team Collaboration: You thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment and love partnering with others to drive results.
 Education: Bachelors degree required.
 Flexible Availability: Able to work full-time, including peak business hours, to support the needs of B2B customers in-store.
 Ability to Travel: You will be required to travel locally as needed to meet with customers, businesses, or partners. Typically this will fall within a 50-mile radius.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity:Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Minimal exposure to workplace or environmental hazardsmust adhere to all safety protocols.

What are the Benefits*?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation, with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and performance based bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to help you grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.
 Time to Recharge: Start accruing paid time off immediatelybecause work-life balance matters.
 401(k) with Company Match: Well match up to 4% to help you plan for your future.
 Tuition Reimbursement: Eligible after 6 months of employmentlearn, grow, and get support along the way.
 Wayfair Employee Discount: Save big on the pieces you love plus get 10% off at our in-store restaurant .
 Parental Leave Options: Choose from paid and unpaid leave plans to support your growing family.
 And So Much More: Weve got more good stuff where that came from! NOTE: our full-time roles receive the full benefits package above, while part-time or seasonal team members may have modified offerings. Your recruiter or in-store team can help with any questions!

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience

Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.

AllModern-Lynnfield, MA (Lynnfield Marketplace)
Overview:At AllModern, we believe everyone deserves a home they love and as a Design Advisor, youll help make that happen. You'll be more than a salesperson; youll be a trusted design partner, guiding customers through everything from furniture selections to full-room transformations. Using your interior design expertise, trend awareness, and flair for customer service, youll help bring their vision to lifewhether in-store, virtually, or in their home.
This role blends creativity and strategy, giving you the tools to inspire and the autonomy to deliver results. From room layouts to fabric swatches, your design solutions will reflect each customers unique style, budget, and needs. Were not just a storewere a community of creators, doers, and dreamers. Ready to help customers fall in love with their homesand your career? Lets make it happen.

Whether its a growing family, a new pet, or a dream remodel, youll help it all come together beautifully.

Redefine Delivery Speed in Global E-commerce!
Ever wondered what it takes to deliver happiness to millions of homes, faster than ever before? At Wayfair, that's our challenge, and our obsession. We know that for our customers and suppliers, speed isn't just a preference - it's a critical factor for success and sales. Our Global Order to Ship team is the engine driving this imperative, constantly innovating to boost performance across our entire fulfillment network.
As a Senior Analyst, you won't just analyse; you'll drive real-world speed improvements across our UK operations. Your primary mission? To unlock the full potential of our dropship supplier network through deep collaboration with Category Management and other internal teams.
If you're a proactive problem-solver who excels at building bridges, identifying inefficiencies between partners, and then removing those roadblocks, you'll thrive here!

Actively integrate data, leveraging analytics to scope and implement levers to drive speed & reliability globally, and create monitoring tools to track progress.
Build and nurture close partnerships with our Category Management team to ensure successful implementation of driven initiatives.
Collaborate with other global cross-functional partners to drive team goals including Operations, Services, GSCI & Transportation.
Coordinate peak planning initiatives for high volume events.
Monitor and troubleshoot key performance indicators of speed and take corrective actions.
Offer SME Speed Support for Category Management via slack, Infohub or required training.
Communicate performance trends and improvement opportunities to leadership.

What You Bring:

Proven success operating within an analytical focused role providing agile business insights for impactful business decisions. Ideally, within an operational/ supply chain environment.
Hold a Bachelors degree in an Analytical, Supply Chain, Economics or Engineering quantitative field; or be qualified by experience.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI).
A Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills (written, verbally & in person), someone who can translate complex data in a clear and concise manner to quickly build strong and trusting stakeholder partnerships.
